instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.I2C_BKLT_SDA: What is I2C_BKLT_SDA? I2C_BKLT_SDA is a data line between the LCD screen and the LED driver. This data line cannot short to ground. If it does, the screen cannot talk to the LED driver, and the LED driver will not allow the circuit to produce a backlight..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA is a data line between the system management controller(SMC), temperature sensors, GPU, and ALS(ambient light sensor). If this line is pulled down the machine may run slow or have the fans run fast all the time because the SMC canâ€™t tell what the temperature of parts of the machine like fin stack are. Usual problem is bad webcam, unplug webcam to see if it fixes problem. .
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message:
Turn on and chime with display logo but no back light. LCD connector was corroded chance it and light back in normal.After 10 minutes  testing again no back light and no display. With LCD CONNECTED
1. <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>=0v,  <SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SCL</SIGNAL>=5v, <SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SDA</SIGNAL>=5v, <SIGNAL>LCD_IRQ_L</SIGNAL>=3.3v, <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA</SIGNAL>=3.3v, <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL>=0v.
Need help, Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message: Try another lcd assembly, could be a bad LCD cable too..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message: i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> assembly , is it compatible with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message: Not 100% sure but the 2015 LCDs do light up on 2014 boards I think. The other way around certainly not!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message: Dont have same screen, is there any other way to check it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no back light, water damage.
threads.message: Nope, get some cracked testing assemblies as you will always need them.
